authors.name: OLIVIA HARDING
authors.affiliation: Department of Physiology, Perelman School of Medicine, University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, PA 19104; Aligning Science Across Parkinson’s (ASAP) Collaborative Research Network, Chevy Chase, MD, 20815

before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"cn0us","text":"Prepare poly-L-lysine (PLL)-coated surfaces on which to plate hippocampal neurons by pipetting 700-1000 uL 0.5 mg/mL PLL onto glass-bottomed dishes, prioritizing coverage of the glass imaging window. Neurons may also be fixed on glass coverslips. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7jsba","text":"We altered a previously developed method (dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bxpfpmjn) in order to investigate the interaction of endogenous NEMO with damaged mitochondria in Hippocampal rat neurons. Mitochondrial damage was induced by the administration of 35 nM Antimycin A, a complex III inhibitor, over 1 hr. Here, we visualized neuronal mitochondria with a mito-targeted construct, Mito-SNAP, and a fluorescent SNAP ligand, JaneliaFluor 646, though other mitochondrial markers may be suitable. Endogenous NEMO was visualized with the commercially available anti-NEMO primary antibody (abcam). AntA-treated neurons exhibited fragmented mitochondria. We did not observe a change in the appearance of NEMO labeling in AntA treated cells versus non-treated cells.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2FCA9C12FF0B11EDB9BC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bxpfpmjn"}}}}

funders.grant_id: Mechanisms of mitochondrial damage control by PINK1 and Parkin (ASAP-000350)

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8hkr5","text":"Plate primary hippocampal Sprague Dawley rat neurons (embryonic day 18) on 35 mm glass-bottomed, PLL-coated dishes at 250,00 cells per dish in MEM supplemented with 10% horse serum, 33 mM D-glucose, and 1 mM sodium pyruvate. This is day 0. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ug0e","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"52p51","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"auutg","text":"Information for dissection and separation of hippocampal neurons is not included because we outsource these steps to an on-campus core facility.    ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"encho","text":"Add AraC (5 uM) one day post-plating to prevent glial proliferation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4f6df","text":"Replace media with Neurobasal (Gibco) supplemented with 33 mM D-glucose, 2 mM GlutaMAX (Invitrogen), 100 units/ml penicillin, 100 ug/ml streptomycin, and 2% B-27 (ThermoFisher) (Maintenance Media; MM) and continue to maintain at 37 degrees C, 5% CO2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7mcbt","text":"On day 6, transfect neurons. 0.3 ug Mito-SNAP per 35-mm dish. Use 3.8 uL Lipofectamine 2000 Transfection Reagent (ThermoFisher) per dish. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6csib","text":"Replace neuron media with MM containing 35 nM Antimycin A (or, for control conditions, media containing no small molecule inhibitor) and incubate for 1 hr. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gumk","text":"Incubate neurons in 2 uM SNAP ligand (Janelia-Fluor 646) for 30 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ehulj","text":"Gently add at least 0.5 mL fixative to each dish and incubate 10 min at 37 degrees","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"pdrj","text":"Incubate neurons for at least 2 but no more than 5 hours at 37 degrees C, 5% CO2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fkgc4","text":"Wash 2X, then rest 30 min in conditioned media. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cq2me","text":"Prepare 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA)/4% sucrose in PBS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eiitc","text":"Image samples, for example, with a Nikon Eclipse Ti Microscope with a 100X objective (Apochromat, 1.49-N.A. oil  immersion)  and  an  UltraView  Vox  spinning  disk  confocal  system  (PerkinElmer). Collect Z-stacks at 0.15 nm/step with Volocity acquisition software (PerkinElmer). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8mov6","text":"During this period, prepare fixation reagent (see next step)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5mh97","text":"Thaw a 10 mL aliquot of 4% PFA in PBS using a 37 degree water bath","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ebbhd","text":"Add 0.4 g sucrose to aliquot","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4hicp","text":"Rotate at R.T. for 10 min to dissolve","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"chrq8","text":"Warm 4% PFA/4% sucrose to 37 degrees","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6dk1n","text":"Aspirate PFA and wash samples with PBS 4X 5 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"82ov4","text":"Permeabilize cells by adding at least 300 uL 0.2% Triton-X in PBS for 5 min ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bffjs","text":"Prepare primary solution with a volume of 200 uL * number of dishes. Use anti-NEMO (abcam, raised in rabbit) at a 1:500 dilution in BSA block. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ir84","text":"Block cells with at least 300 uL BSA block (see Materials) for 50 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aqco2","text":"Prepare primary antibody solution during this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e0eq1","text":"Aspirate blocking solution from each sample and gently add 180 uL primary solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ejqqc","text":"Incubate samples in primary solution overnight in a dark environment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ee31k","text":"The following day, aspirate primary solution and add 100-200 uL PBS to wash for 5 min. Carry out PBS wash for a total of 4 times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ilm","text":"Prepare secondary solution with a volume of 110 uL * number of dishes. Use anti-rabbit 488 secondary antibody at 1:200 dilution in BSA block.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5f7e7","text":"Centrifuge primary antibody at 4 degrees, max speed, for 4 min before use. After centrifugation, pipet from top of antibody aliquot.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8od8o","text":"Centrifuge primary antibody at 4 degrees at max speed for 4 min before use. After centrifugation, pipet from top of antibody aliquot.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aoobd","text":"Aspirate PBS from final wash and add 100 uL secondary solution to each sample, making sure to submerge all areas of the glass window. Incubate 1 hr at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4tsgn","text":"Aspirate secondary solution and add 100-200 uL PBS to wash for 5 min. Carry out PBS wash for a total of 2 times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87agt","text":"Prepare Hoechst solution with a volume of 110 uL * number of dishes. Use Hoechst dye at 1:1000 dilution in PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"650i3","text":"Aspirate PBS from second wash and add Hoechst solution. Incubate 5 min at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"coi9m","text":"Repeat step 22. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qn7n","text":"Aspirate final PBS wash and gently add enough volume of Vectashield to cover surface of glass window. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"693bf","text":"Incubate transfected neurons 36-48 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bl6p","text":"Equilibrate a volume of fresh MM equal to 2 mL per dish by incubating MM in a flask in the cell culture incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"do06a","text":"Replace conditioned MM with 1 mL fresh MM for each dish. Save conditioned MM in a fresh flask in the incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ds4ph","text":"Prepare transfection solutions A and B by adding 0.3 ug Mito-SNAP to 150 uL Neurobasal (A) and 3.8 uL Lipofectamine 2000 to 150 uL Neurobasal (B) for each dish. Rotate by hand 8 times and incubate at room temperature for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0rq3","text":"Briefly centrifuge A and B with a tabletop centrifuge. Then combine A and B and rotate by hand 8 times to mix. Incubate at room temperature for 20 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4lo5m","text":"Add A+B (300 uL) to each dish of primary neurons dropwise. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ddtv","text":"Incubate at 37 degrees 45 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9m21h","text":"Replace transfection media with 50%/50% fresh and conditioned media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"568qs","text":"Allow neurons to grow until Day 6.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Fixing hippo neurons to assess endogenous NEMO during oxidative stress
title_html: Fixing hippo neurons to assess endogenous NEMO during oxidative stress

versions.title: Fixing hippo neurons to assess endogenous NEMO during oxidative stress
versions.title_html: Fixing hippo neurons to assess endogenous NEMO during oxidative stress
